item.title: 森特诺告诉《政治家》：欧洲央行可能不得不加快降息步伐
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马里奥-森特诺（Mario Centeno）告诉 Politico，欧洲中央银行可能不得不加快降息步伐，以避免通胀率低于预期。【原文：The European Central Bank may have to quicken the pace that it lowers interest rates to avoid inflation falling short of forecasts, Governing Council member Mario Centeno told Politico.】

item.title: BancTrust 称美联储降息可能刺激尼日利亚和安哥拉的欧洲债券销售
item.description: BancTrust & Co.称，美联储降息半个百分点可能会为尼日利亚和安哥拉等非洲国家发行新债铺平道路。【原文：The Federal Reserve’s half-percentage-point interest-rate cut may pave the way for new debt issuance by African nations including Nigeria and Angola, according to BancTrust & Co.】

item.title: 报告称国泰航空发动机起火可能导致重大损失
item.description: 一份初步报告称，本月早些时候国泰航空公司一架航班的发动机在空中起火，火势可能蔓延并对飞机造成大面积损坏。【原文：A midair engine fire on a Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd. flight earlier this month could have spread and caused widespread damage to the plane, a preliminary report said, as investigations continue into the incident and the failed components.】

item.title: 美联储降息，亚洲货币创 14 个月新高
item.description: 在美联储启动宽松政策并表示今年将进一步缩减后，亚洲货币升至一年多来最强劲的水平。【原文：Asian currencies advanced to the strongest level in more than a year after the Federal Reserve kicked off policy easing and signaled further reductions this year.】

item.title: 美联储利率中枢有望推动亚洲资产大幅上涨
item.description: 美联储转向降息对亚洲资产来说是个好兆头，因为许多亚洲资产被低估，与全球同类资产相比，亚洲资产的盈利前景更好，从宽松政策中获益的空间更大。【原文：The Federal Reserve’s shift to interest-rate cuts bodes well for Asian assets as many are underowned, and have better earnings prospects and more room to benefit from easing than their global peers.】

item.title: 男孩被刺身亡后，日本公司提醒在华员工注意安全
item.description: 一名日本小男孩在中国大陆被刺身亡后，日本一些最大的公司敦促保护在中国的员工。【原文：Some of Japan’s biggest companies urged the protection of employees in China, following the fatal stabbing in the mainland of a young Japanese boy.】

item.title: 区块链公司Blockdaemon权衡2026年上市可能性
item.description: 区块链基础设施提供商Blockdaemon公司创始人康斯坦丁-里希特（Konstantin Richter）表示，该公司可能会在2026年进行首次公开募股。【原文：Blockchain infrastructure provider Blockdaemon Inc. may pursue an initial public offering in 2026, its founder Konstantin Richter said.】

item.title: 南非央行四年来首次降息，兰特上涨
item.description: 周四上午，兰特在南非储备银行利率决议公布前上涨，预计该央行将自2020年7月以来首次降息。【原文：The rand gained Thursday morning ahead of a South African Reserve Bank interest rate decision, where the central bank is expected to deliver its first cut since July 2020.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国央行决议前，美联储将提振英国股市
新加坡金管局政策转变在即，新加坡与美国的掉期差距将缩小
item.description: 新加坡不寻常的货币政策将为交易商提供一个机会，从当地货币与美元利率掉期之间不断缩小的差距中获利。【原文：Singapore’s unusual approach to monetary policy will give traders a chance to profit from a narrowing gap between the local currency and US dollar interest-rate swaps.】

item.title: 印度在 MSCI 全球股票指数中的排名超越中国，推动资金流动
item.description: 印度在全球主要指标中超过中国，可能会带来更多的外资流入，从而再次推动这个南亚国家的股票市场。【原文：India’s overtaking of China in key global gauges will likely usher in a bigger influx of foreign flows, giving equities in the South Asian country another boost.】

item.title: 东京延长股票交易时间，担忧加剧可能引发波动
item.description: 11 月份东京证券交易所延长交易时间后，日本股市可能会更加动荡，继上个月市场暴跌之后，投资者可能会被吓跑。【原文：Japanese equities may become more volatile after the Tokyo Stock Exchange extends its trading hours in November, with the risk that investors might be scared off as it comes on the heels of last month’s market crash.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

】

item.title: 黎巴嫩爆炸事件中的对讲机至少是十年前制造的
item.description: 在黎巴嫩爆炸的对讲机上出现了日本 Icom 公司的品牌，该公司表示，它在十年前就停产了在袭击中被拍到的型号，目前仍在对情况进行调查。【原文：Japan’s Icom Inc., whose brand appears on walkie-talkies that exploded in Lebanon, said it discontinued production a decade ago of the model photographed in the attacks and is still investigating the situation.】

item.title: 多晶硅价格预计将因中国减产而上涨
item.description: 中国硅业协会表示，多晶硅是太阳能电池板的关键成分，由于生产商因太阳能行业不景气而削减产能，多晶硅的价格将在年底前反弹。【原文：The price of polysilicon — a key ingredient in solar panels — should rally through the year-end as producers cut capacity due to a slump in the sector, the China Silicon Industry Association said.】

item.title: 小麦下跌，原因是需求疲软、美国天气转好超过了美联储减产的影响
item.description: 小麦下跌的原因是欧洲需求疲软和美国天气改善，给美联储大幅降息蒙上了阴影。【原文：Wheat fell as weak European demand and improving weather in the US overshadowed an outsized interest-rate cut from the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德（Brookfield）将在印度基础设施领域追加 130 亿美元赌注
item.description: 布鲁克菲尔德资产管理有限公司（Brookfield Asset Management Ltd.）计划在已投资 130 亿美元的基础上，再增加对印度基础设施的投资，并称印度是新兴市场中的 "亮点"。【原文：Brookfield Asset Management Ltd. plans to add to the $13 billion it has already invested in Indian infrastructure, describing it as the “brightest spot” in emerging markets.】

item.title: 美国降息提振亚洲，Blackstone 将亚洲视为增长引擎
item.description: 全球最大的资产管理公司之一黑石集团 (Blackstone Inc.) 将亚洲视为 "增长引擎"。【原文：Blackstone Inc., one of the largest asset managers in the world, sees Asia as a “growth engine,” according to Amit Dixit, the firm’s head of private equity for the region.】

item.title: 市场领会鲍威尔的信息— 小规模长期化
item.description:
美联储主席迅速释放了降息 50 个基点的压力，浇灭了未来的预期

。【原文：

The steam from a 50-basis-point rate cut was let out quickly by the Fed chief dousing future expectations

】

item.title: 汇丰银行 2019 年以来首次下调香港主要利率
item.description: 汇丰控股有限公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）自 2019 年以来首次下调香港的主要基准利率，此举可能会打击利润率，同时为亚洲金融中心的房主和借款人带来宽慰。【原文：HSBC Holdings Plc cut its key benchmark rate in Hong Kong for the first time since 2019, a move likely to hit margins while bringing relief to homeowners and borrowers in the Asian financial hub.】

item.title: 印尼调查佐科威和六百万纳税人遭黑客攻击的指控
item.description: 印尼税务机构正在调查关于包括佐科-维多多总统及其部长在内的数百万纳税人的数据被泄露到网上的说法。【原文：Indonesia’s tax agency is investigating claims that data from millions of taxpayers, including President Joko Widodo and his ministers, have been leaked online.】

item.title: 微软与初创公司 Anduril 合作开发陆军作战护目镜系统
item.description: 国防技术初创公司安杜里尔工业公司（Anduril Industries Inc.【原文：Defense technology startup Anduril Industries Inc. is teaming up with Microsoft Corp. to improve the performance of new combat goggles for the US Army, Anduril said Thursday, in a project that may generate as much as $21.9 billion from the service over a decade.】

item.title: Salesforce 是人工智能竞赛中的一匹黑马
item.description:
它已做好部署全新 "代理 "工具的充分准备，并毫不讳言该技术将如何取代工作。【原文：

It’s well positioned to deploy a radical new ‘agents’ tool, and it’s not shy about how that technology will replace jobs.

】

item.title: 德国电动汽车销量下滑拖累欧洲汽车市场
item.description: 最近几周，德国受到经济不景气的影响，上个月欧洲汽车销量下滑，电动汽车需求萎缩。【原文：Germany, hit by bad economic news in recent weeks, led a drop in European car sales last month as demand for electric vehicles cratered.】

item.title: 全球基金对中国银行业债务持冷淡态度 资金流入减少
item.description: 由于人民币对美元走强，上个月全球基金购买中国纸币的速度大幅放缓，这削弱了以掉期为基础的流行交易的吸引力。【原文：Global funds’ purchase of Chinese bank notes dramatically slowed last month as the yuan strengthened against the dollar, denting the appeal of a popular swap-based trade.】

item.title: 新加坡股市因加息希望和股息而创下 17 年新高
item.description: 新加坡股市有望创下 2007 年以来的最高收盘价，因为利率下调的前景提振了这个城市国家的房地产投资信托基金，并增加了这个高收益市场的吸引力。【原文：Singapore stocks are on track for their highest close since 2007 as the prospect of lower interest rates lifts the city-state’s real estate investment trusts, and adds to the appeal of the high-yielding market.】

item.title: 美联储降息半点初步提振金属走势不一
item.description: 铜价接近三周来的最高收盘价，其他金属则涨跌不一，因为投资者正在消化美联储通过降息半点来捍卫美国经济增长和劳动力市场的举措。【原文：Copper traded near its highest close in three weeks and other metals were mixed as investors digested the Federal Reserve’s bid to defend US growth and the labor market with a half-point rate-cut.】

item.title: 美元在英国央行和日本央行利率决议前的 "关键窗口期 "上涨
item.description: 美元在美联储超大规模降息后上涨，交易员们正在等待英国和日本央行在未来 24 小时内做出决定，以评估它们对市场的综合影响。【原文：The dollar rose in the aftermath of the Federal Reserve’s supersized rate cut, with traders waiting for decisions from the UK and Japanese central banks over the next 24 hours to assess their combined impact on markets.】

item.title: 美联储减息后外资流入将增加
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 日本央行会议将考验对日元敏感的日本股市的命运
item.description: 押注日本股市进一步回升的交易员们正在关注日本央行的任何指示，这些指示可能会限制日元的涨幅并支持出口商。【原文：Traders betting on further recovery in Japanese equities are looking to any steer from the Bank of Japan that may cap the yen’s gains and support exporters.】
